captions.text:
Are you dumb,
or just plain stupid?

<i>Now, you wouldn't</i>
<i>believe if I told you...</i>

But I could run
like the wind blows.

That boy sure
is a running fool.

comments.author: xavier415

comments.text:
After his mother died, he ran straight away and ran for his few years. I 
used to think that his reaction was a way of "running away" from the 
problem.

But now after re-watching this I think it's more about reconnecting with 
his childhood, the thing which made him. The time when everything is 
carefree and he had his mother to look after him, and he was always with 
Jenny. 

As a kid he ran everywhere, and older Forrest runs everywhere to feel like 
a care free child again. He said during that time he thought about mama and 
jenny a lot. 

He couldn't handle it , and he didn't know how to overcome what happened 
because he wasn't smart enough, his body took over and made him run back to 
his childhood! 



That's why he was doing it! Not for world peace or women's rights! ﻿

comments.text:
Im from texas i just had q giod young country life at the very first and 
lived n a place for homeless people at 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 lived n a garage 
lived a life that was blessed by many and was abused by those closest i 
soon told myself i creat my life i seen wut was great n the life of others 
so i became a man at a young age did foot ball from 6th grade to 11th did 
track and cross country n the 10th grade i did it for a girl i loved ahe 
was n track and cross also i nvr gave up i told my self i build myself and 
i will creat my life my step dad youst to abuse me and my sister when we 
was young from age 5 to 15 she was 3 to 13 he always told me ur nobody u r 
going to be a bumb like ur day and nvr get a job u wont gradguate u will 
always live of of someone els. I did wit i had to to take care of my sister 
my mom didnt do anything my older siter was raped by my step dads brother 
and my step dad they druged her with exstacy when i was 10 i didnt know it 
happen till later n life. My mom was n the room nxt to my older sisters.. 
its a shame i made my life i nvr gave up nvr let anyone stop u from 
believing u can but always be willing to learn and see others perspectives 
and u will c more and learn how to take care of something when the time 
comes but also learn from others mistakes and u will not do the same u will 
b more aware of how to go about something. History will repeat itself if 
people dont learn from ther mistakes.

comments.text:
Nope Texas country as a youngen city boy at about 4and a half and had nvr 
new my dad had a abusive step dad. and I always look at others t c wut life 
was about. As I grew I learned u have to creat urself. because being 
bullyed as a kiddo n school ther was a time I felt as no one lost and 
confused. I went to church ounce n a while. I played football n middle 
school sixth grade had a Dude knock my glasses of my face so I started 
hitten him the coach asked y I told him than he walked away. seventh played 
foot ball learned I had to work out. Loved a girl at a time but another 
girl said she was dared to go out with me and it was over never kissed. 
Hade the greatest history teacher learned a lot about history. Highschool 
played football did track and cross country I worked out and could run 
greatly I met a girl who I wished would some day be my wife. With great 
hope and visions of a better tomorow or life ones will power is endless 
love is strong. I became the fastest person n track n a 5 star school with 
over 2 thousand people attended but I fell n one class and nvr got to go to 
the meets life has bein a journey of lessons nvr give up on yourselves 
people u can do anything u believe and u put your heart to. amen good bye.
